25 namespace detail

27 
28 /*
29  * A clock type for simulation time points.
30  *
31  * This class fulfils the syntactic requirements of the "Clock" concept
32  * (https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/named_req/Clock), but it does not have
33  * any relation to wall-clock time, nor to the logical time of any specific
34  * simulation. (The `now()` method is therefore deleted.) Its sole raison
35  * d'Ã¨tre is to be a basis for the definition of `time_point`.
36  *
37  */
38 class clock
39 {
40 public:
41  using rep = std::int64_t;
42  using period = std::nano;
43  using duration = std::chrono::duration<rep, period>;
44  using time_point = std::chrono::time_point<clock>;
45  static constexpr bool is_steady = false;
46  static time_point now() = delete;
47 };
48 
49 } // namespace detail
50 
51 
53 using duration = detail::clock::duration;
54 
55 
57 using time_point = detail::clock::time_point;
58 
59 
69 constexpr duration to_duration(double d)
70 {
71  return std::chrono::duration_cast<duration>(std::chrono::duration<double>(d));
72 }
73 
74 
85 constexpr time_point to_time_point(double t)
86 {
87  return time_point(to_duration(t));
88 }
89 
90 
101 constexpr double to_double_time_point(time_point t)
102 {
103  return std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::duration<double>>(
104  t.time_since_epoch())
105  .count();
106 }
107 
108 
127 constexpr duration to_duration(double d, double startTime)
128 {
129  return to_time_point(startTime + d) - to_time_point(startTime);
130 }
131 
132 
151 constexpr double to_double_duration(duration d, time_point startTime)
152 {
153  return to_double_time_point(startTime + d) - to_double_time_point(startTime);
154 }

162 enum class variable_type
163 {
164  real,
165  integer,
166  boolean,
167  string,
168  enumeration
169 };

173 enum variable_causality
174 {
175  parameter,
176  calculated_parameter,
177  input,
178  output,
179  local
180 };
181 
182 
184 enum variable_variability
185 {
186  constant,
187  fixed,
188  tunable,
189  discrete,
190  continuous
191 };
192 
193 
195 constexpr const char* to_text(variable_type v)
196 {
197  switch (v) {
198  case variable_type::real: return "real";
199  case variable_type::integer: return "integer";
200  case variable_type::boolean: return "boolean";
201  case variable_type::string: return "string";
202  case variable_type::enumeration: return "enumeration";
203  default: return nullptr;
204  }
205 }
206 
207 
209 constexpr const char* to_text(variable_causality v)
210 {
211  switch (v) {
212  case variable_causality::parameter: return "parameter";
213  case variable_causality::calculated_parameter: return "calculated_parameter";
214  case variable_causality::input: return "input";
215  case variable_causality::output: return "output";
216  case variable_causality::local: return "local";
217  default: return nullptr;
218  }
219 }
220 
221 
223 constexpr const char* to_text(variable_variability v)
224 {
225  switch (v) {
226  case variable_variability::constant: return "constant";
227  case variable_variability::fixed: return "fixed";
228  case variable_variability::tunable: return "tunable";
229  case variable_variability::discrete: return "discrete";
230  case variable_variability::continuous: return "continuous";
231  default: return nullptr;
232  }
233 }

237 inline std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& stream, variable_type v)
